| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | [EvilHack - monst.c, line 1079](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/master/src/monst.c#L1079) |

A **jumping spider**, s, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is a type of [spider](/wiki/Spider "Spider") that has the ability to [jump](/wiki/Jump "Jump") at [you](/wiki/You "You") and other monsters, spin [webs](/wiki/Web "Web"), and [hide](/wiki/Hide "Hide") themselves under objects like most other [arachnids and centipedes](/wiki/Arachnid_or_centipede "Arachnid or centipede") can. [Drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)") can tame jumping spiders as [domestic animals](/wiki/Domestic_animal "Domestic animal").

A jumping spider has a [poisonous](/wiki/Poison "Poison") bite attack, and possesses [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

A jumping spider [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") is poisonous to eat, but eating a jumping spider corpse or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") conveys 1⁄20 poison resistance.

## Generation

Randomly generated jumping spiders are always created hostile.

Jumping spiders appear among the random s that are part of the first [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster class for [Tourists](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist") and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Tourist quest](/wiki/Tourist_quest "Tourist quest"). They also appear among the random s that are part of the second quest monster class for [Rangers](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Ranger quest](/wiki/Ranger_quest "Ranger quest").

Hostile jumping spiders can be generated by the [summon insects](/wiki/Summon_insects "Summon insects") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") when cast by [Lolth](/wiki/Lolth_\(EvilHack\) "Lolth (EvilHack)") or a [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(monster_attribute\) "Drow (monster attribute)") monster.

Jumping spiders generated at level creation, including on web traps, are given a random item to hide under.

## Encyclopedia entry

Eight legged creature capable of spinning webs to trap prey.  
\[]  
  
"You mean you eat flies?" gasped Wilbur.  
"Certainly. Flies, bugs, grasshoppers, choice beetles,  
moths, butterflies, tasty cockroaches, gnats, midges, daddy  
longlegs, centipedes, mosquitoes, crickets - anything that is  
careless enough to get caught in my web. I have to live,  
don't I?"  
"Why, yes, of course," said Wilbur.  
\[ Charlotte's Web, by E.B. White ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Jumping_spider\&action=edit)*

html:
Jumping spider

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
s jumping spider (No tile)
Difficulty 5
Attacks Bite 1d4 poison
s jumping spider (No tile)
Difficulty 5
Attacks

Bite 1d4 poison

Base level 3
Base experience 19
Speed 15
Base AC 3
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 75
Nutritional value 75
Size Small
Resistances poison
Resistances conveyed poison (20%)

A jumping spider:

  • can hide under items.
  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • can lay eggs.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • normally appears in small groups.
Reference EvilHack - monst.c, line 1079

A jumping spider, s, is a type of monster that appears in EvilHack and Hack'EM. It is a type of spider that has the ability to jump at you and other monsters, spin webs, and hide themselves under objects like most other arachnids and centipedes can. Drow can tame jumping spiders as domestic animals.

A jumping spider has a poisonous bite attack, and possesses poison resistance.

A jumping spider corpse is poisonous to eat, but eating a jumping spider corpse or tin conveys 1⁄20 poison resistance.

Generation

Randomly generated jumping spiders are always created hostile.

Jumping spiders appear among the random s that are part of the first quest monster class for Tourists and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Tourist quest. They also appear among the random s that are part of the second quest monster class for Rangers and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Ranger quest.

Hostile jumping spiders can be generated by the summon insects monster spell when cast by Lolth or a drow monster.

Jumping spiders generated at level creation, including on web traps, are given a random item to hide under.

Encyclopedia entry

Eight legged creature capable of spinning webs to trap prey.
[]

"You mean you eat flies?" gasped Wilbur.
"Certainly. Flies, bugs, grasshoppers, choice beetles,
moths, butterflies, tasty cockroaches, gnats, midges, daddy
longlegs, centipedes, mosquitoes, crickets - anything that is
careless enough to get caught in my web. I have to live,
don't I?"
"Why, yes, of course," said Wilbur.
[ Charlotte's Web, by E.B. White ]

A '''jumping spider''', {{cyan|s}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. It is a type of [[spider]] that has the ability to [[jump]] at [[you]] and other monsters, spin [[web]]s, and [[hide]] themselves under objects like most other [[Arachnid or centipede|arachnids and centipedes]] can. [[Drow (starting race)|Drow]] can tame jumping spiders as [[domestic animal]]s.

A jumping spider has a [[poison]]ous bite attack, and possesses [[poison resistance]].

A jumping spider [[corpse]] is poisonous to eat, but eating a jumping spider corpse or [[tin]] conveys {{frac|20}} poison resistance.

==Generation==
Randomly generated jumping spiders are always created hostile.

Jumping spiders appear among the random {{white|s}} that are part of the first [[quest]] monster class for [[Tourist]]s and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Tourist quest]]. They also appear among the random {{white|s}} that are part of the second quest monster class for [[Ranger]]s and make up {{frac|6|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Ranger quest]].

Hostile jumping spiders can be generated by the [[summon insects]] [[monster spell]] when cast by [[Lolth (EvilHack)|Lolth]] or a [[Drow (monster attribute)|drow]] monster.

Jumping spiders generated at level creation, including on web traps, are given a random item to hide under.
